page.title: 15PROPOSED NEW COAL MINE
page.content: In south west Coventry there is concern over the possible siting of the Â£450million Warwickshire super pit. This should go into production in about 11 years time, mining 3 million tons of coal a year. About 1 3/4 million tons will go in 10 trainloads a day to power stations, with 1 1/4 million tons going by road in up to 510 lorries a day. British Rail will probably re-open the old disused branch line between Berkswell and Crackley Junction near Kenilworth on the Coventry to Oxford line. The trains could leave the pit without interfering with high speed trains. The lorries are likely to cause most alarm to local people as most of the lanes in the area are winding country lanes. A new link road to the A45 would need to be built to take the bulk of this traffic.
